Los_Angeles.Spring Street School:
Spring Street School was the first public school in Los Angeles, California, built first at Second and Spring streets and then moved to a lot facing both Broadway and Spring Street midblock between Fifth and Sixth streets in the Downtown district.


== Campuses ==


=== Second and Spring ===
Spring Street School was the first public school in the city of Los Angeles. constructed at Second and Spring streets, where a Los Angeles Times building now stands
In 1873 the original Spring Street School housed a hundred pupils and one teacher; in the five schools in Los Angeles there were 14 teachers and 835 pupils, or 60 children per teacher.
